item.title: MATH170-lecture-20211012
item.description: MATLAB # An introduction # File: m170-matlab-linprog.pdf For example, lets define a vector x = [1 2 3] If we want to transpose x, we can use the ': x' Or we can define a column vector like: y=[1 2 3] which can also be defined with ;: y=[1;2;3] So, to define an entire matrix we can use a combination of both: A=[1 2 3; 4 5 6; 7 8 9] We can do some matrix multiplication:
